business.headline: SIPs for the win? Why investors are betting big on mutual funds amid tariff turmoilMutual funds are seeing record inflows even as markets struggle. Are SIP investors spotting an opportunity the rest are missing, or is it just faith in long-term discipline?
India bans land imports of more Bangladesh jute productsEarlier on June 27, India prohibited imports of a number of jute products and woven fabrics from Bangladesh through all land routes.

5 SIP myths that hurt investors more than markets, explains stock market expertMany investors blame market volatility for poor returns, but often, it's the myths they believe about SIPs that do more harm. Here's what an expert reveals.

How to repay a Rs 1 crore home loan in under 10 years and save Rs 52 lakhThe joy of getting the keys to your home is unmatched, but the reality of a 20-year (or longer) home loan often brings with it a heavy financial commitment.

Trump tariffs could worsen India's affordable housing crisis. Here's howDonald Trump's steep tariffs on Indian exports risk inflating construction costs, squeezing developers, and pushing affordable housing further out of reach for millions already struggling in India's overheated property market

New and old income tax regimes explained as ITR filing deadline extendedFor FY 2024-25, the new tax regime is automatically applied to taxpayers. Salaried individuals can still choose the old regime while filing their return, but if you miss the due date and file a belated ITR, it can only be done under the new regime.

Field notes from building a billion-dollar luxury brandDiverse leadership isn't just good business, it's the future blueprint for luxury real estate success. Parisa Seif, Managing Partner at Kleindienst Group, writes

New Income Tax Bill 2025: Will changes in the revised bill impact taxpayers?The updated Bill, presented by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on August 11, incorporates most of the recommendations made by the Select Committee. It is set to replace the six-decade-old Income Tax Act, 1961.

Sensex, Nifty rebound after falling in early trade; inflation data in focusThe S&P BSE Sensex fell over 150 points at the opening bell but swiftly recovered by 9:23 am. The Sensex was trading 10 points higher at 80,614.05, while the NSE Nifty50 traded 12.80 points higher at 24,597.85.

JSW Cement IPO allotment today: Check status online, listing date and GMPInvestors who applied for JSW IPO can check their allotment status online through the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website or the portal of KFin Technologies Limited.
Is it smart to use personal loan to fund your next trip?Most of the rise in holiday loans is from non-metro India. In 2025, 71% of borrowers came from Tier-2 and Tier-3 cities, up from 68% in 2023.

New Income Tax Bill approved: What's new after withdrawal of earlier draftThe original Income Tax Bill, 2025, was introduced on February 13 to replace the six-decade-old Income Tax Act, 1961. However, last week, the government decided to pull it back, saying the changes suggested by the Select Committee needed to be included in a fresh draft.

entertainment.headline: Param Sundari trailer: Fun, romance and Rajinikanth in Janhvi-Sidharth's love storyThe much-awaited trailer for 'Param Sundari' featuring Sidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor has released. 'Param Sundari' will release in theatres on August 29.

Dogs are Delhiites: John Abraham to Chief Justice over court's order on straysActor John Abraham wrote a letter to Chief Justice BR Gavai, urging the court to review its order on stray dogs in Delhi. The actor also cited the World Health Organisation in his letter.

Rajinikanth called out for body-shaming Coolie co-stars Soubin Shahir, Aamir KhanSuperstar Rajinikanth delivered a 41-minute speech at the 'Coolie' audio launch. However, he was criticised for calling Aamir Khan 'short' and Soubin Shahir 'bald'.

Vir Das, Janhvi Kapoor, other celebs react to Supreme Court stray dog orderBollywood stars have opposed the Supreme Court's order against stray dogs. Actors like Janhvi Kapoor and Varun Dhawan say, "Just no compassion left."

KBC 17: Officers Sofiya Qureshi, Vyomika Singh recount Operation Sindoor with Big BActor Amitabh Bachchan welcomed Col Sofiya Qureshi, Wing Commander Vyomika Singh and Commander Prerna Deosthalee in 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17'. The upcoming episode has been shot as an Independence Day special.

Hip-hop duo Seedhe Maut approached for Bigg Boss 19: SourceThe makers of the much-awaited reality show 'Bigg Boss 19' have reportedly approached hip-hop duo Seedhe Maut. Having delivered songs like 'Raat Ki Rani' and 'Khatta Flow', Siddhant Sharma and Abhijay Negi have a massive fan following amongst Gen Z.

Not just Indian companies, Singapore firm announces holiday for Rajinikanth's CoolieTwo Singapore companies offered paid holidays for Tamil workers to watch Rajinikanth's 'Coolie'. Many Indian companies announced holidays on August 14 as well.

Coolie piracy blocked by Madras High Court, new order passed for Rajinikanth's filmMadras High Court intervenes to curb piracy of Rajinikanth's 'Coolie', ahead of its release, blocking ISPs and cable networks from streaming pirated versions. The court highlights that the producers will have to suffer an 'irreparable injury' if piracy persists.

Coolie advance sales skyrocket in US, Rajinikanth craze explodes in India'Coolie' has now achieved an unprecedented feat at the box office. The Rajinikanth starrer has registered a huge presence at the ticket window in the US, setting new records for Tamil cinema.

Nidhhi Agerwal denies role in using Andhra Pradesh government car for eventActor Nidhhi Agerwal clarified her non-involvement in using the Andhra Pradesh government car for an event. She explained that she had no role in it.

KBC 17: First contestant quits at Rs 50 lakh question on Rabindranath TagoreAmitabh Bachchan-hosted show, 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17', kicked off on August 11. The first contestant on the hot seat failed to answer the Rs 50 lakh question.

Jolly LLB 3 teaser: Akshay-Arshad's courtroom clash turns into a laugh riot'Jolly LLB 3' teaser featuring Akshay Kumar and Arshad Warsi is finally out. The film is slated to release in theatres on September 19.

Taylor Swift enters 12th era, announces new album The Life of a ShowgirlPop singer Taylor Swift confirmed her forthcoming 12th album in an Instagram video promoting the Wednesday special episode of boyfriend Travis Kelce's podcast 'New Heights'.

Kay Kay Menon says Congress misused his clip, denies role in 'vote chori' campaignActor Kay Kay Menon shared a post and denied his involvement in Congress's latest 'Vote Chori' campaign. He claimed that the political party used his clip without permission.

Coolie song Monica gets Monica Bellucci's stamp of approval. Pooja Hegde reactsPooja Hegde's song 'Monica' from the film 'Coolie' directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj has now received praise from Monica Bellucci. The 'Retro' actor called it the biggest compliment ever.
Taylor Swift, Travis Kelce's new podcast promo is pure romance. WatchTravis Kelce's podcast promo with Taylor Swift has left fans excited. The video will out on August 13 (ET).

My heart is full: Nick Jonas reflects on MetLife show, Priyanka says so proudSeveral artists, including Demi Lovato, took the stage with the Jonas Brothers, captivating the audience with their performances. Nick Jonas even shared an emotional note while thanking all for their love.

Coolie mania: Rs 4,500 for 1st show, Rajinikanth fans to cross states to watch filmThe craze for Superstar Rajinikanth's upcoming film 'Coolie' is unprecedented. The film's first-day first-show tickets are being sold for as high as Rs 4,500 in black in Chennai.

Jennifer Aniston says Friends cast mourned Mathew Perry long before his deathActor Jennifer Aniston revealed the 'Friends' cast had been mourning former co-star Matthew Perry before his death in October 2023. She highlighted his tough battle with addiction and shared that he was healthy and happy before he died.

general news.headline: Cash row: Lok Sabha forms panel on proposal to impeach Justice VarmaLok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Tuesday accepted the motion signed by 146 MPs for the impeachment of Justice Yashwant Varma, from whose residence a huge pile of cash was found.

In terror tag for Baloch group, Trump largesse for Pak. Message for India?While the Balochistan Liberation Army has been behind several attacks in Pakistan, particularly targeting its military, what is significant here is the timing of the US announcement.

Don't discard food in open: Top Court circular over stray dogs on premisesA day after the controversial order on Delhi's stray dogs, the Supreme Court has issued a circular directing that all leftover food should be discarded in covered bins to over strays on premises.

Heera Mandi 2.0: From flings to fights, Pak's transactional ties with the USIn a world of diplomatic flirtations, Washington and Islamabad star in a transactional situationship. Their unstable love-hate saga teeters on mistrust, power plays, and fleeting alliances. We revisit this rom-com with a series of scandalous stories.

China plans railway line to India's doorsteps, sparks twin concernChina is set to build a massive railway line linking Tibet and northwestern Xinjiang, which reports say will pass near the LAC with India. Beijing's rail push, right through India's Aksai Chin, is expected to add to New Delhi's concerns. Beijing is planning a rail network up to the Nepal border, and the sensitive Chumbi Valley, the area of the 2017 Doklam stand-off.

Woman alleges 9 fake votes registered on address in BJP's lone Kerala seatA woman in Kerala's Thrissur alleged that nine fake votes were added using her address without her knowledge. CPM claims vacant flats in Poonkunnam were misused for voter list manipulation. Opposition leaders demand a probe into alleged BJP-linked irregularities.

Delhi-NCR stares at house help crisis amid exodus of Bengali migrantsThe corporate and IT hubs of Noida and Gurgaon, which house a large working-class population, run on migrant labour. A crackdown against illegal Bangladeshi immigrants and fears of a Bihar-like special intensive revision (SIR) of electoral rolls in West Bengal has led to a sudden exodus of Bengali migrants. Even as a humanitarian crisis unfolds, Delhi-NCR is staring at a domestic help crisis.

Congress High Command sacked me: Ex-Karnataka Minister vows to expose conspiracyFormer Karnataka minister KN Rajanna said the Congress high command was behind his removal. He hinted at a conspiracy but promised details later. His ouster followed remarks on voter list lapses during Congress rule.

Coolie mania: Rs 4,500 for 1st show, Rajinikanth fans to cross states to watch filmThe craze for Superstar Rajinikanth's upcoming film 'Coolie' is unprecedented. The film's first-day first-show tickets are being sold for as high as Rs 4,500 in black in Chennai.

Trump tariffs could worsen India's affordable housing crisis. Here's howDonald Trump's steep tariffs on Indian exports risk inflating construction costs, squeezing developers, and pushing affordable housing further out of reach for millions already struggling in India's overheated property market
Field Marshal Asim Munir's Armageddon rantThe Pakistan Army chief has transformed himself into a vile, windbag provocateur threatening nuclear weapons use. Here's why the world must worry.

Can't kick India around: Ex-Pentagon official praises PM's tough stand on US tiesFormer Pentagon official Michael Rubin said PM Modi's stance would mark the moment the US learnt it can't kick India around. He criticised Trump's position and warned that Pakistan has lost legitimacy over its nuclear threats.

Where have Gurugram's gurgling river, green hills gone?Gurugram's rise as a corporate powerhouse has come at the expense of its rivers, wetlands, and the Aravallis that once sustained it. The Sahibi River, the Aravallis, and their forests are now either gone or in a dire state. The city's recurring floods, choking dust, and vanishing green cover are the direct fallout of decades of unchecked, ill-planned "development", which, in effect, have been the reasons for their disappearance.

How to repay a Rs 1 crore home loan in under 10 years and save Rs 52 lakhThe joy of getting the keys to your home is unmatched, but the reality of a 20-year (or longer) home loan often brings with it a heavy financial commitment.

Idle days, wild rumours: Kohli and Rohit deserve to decide ODI futuresFor all the noise about grey beards and holiday photos, the scoreboard still tells the truest story: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma remain match-winners in one-day cricket. The off-season may fuel idle speculation, but the final call on their ODI futures should rest with the men who've carried Indian cricket on their shoulders.

Ek BrahMos chalega: Mithun Chakraborty's reply to Bilawal Bhutto's war threatBilawal Bhutto escalated tensions, warning of war if India alters the Indus Waters Treaty, a day after Pakistani Army chief Asim Munir threatened nuclear retaliation and compared Islamabad's standing to a "dump truck" against New Delhi.

What are Animal Birth Control rules that court mentioned in its stray dog orderThe Supreme Court's order, as well as its criticism of the ABC Rules, which lay out norms for sterilisation of stray dogs, has received pushback from animal welfare activists and NGOs.

Lingering Fatigue, dizziness, weakness: The anemia crisis is striking urban womenAnemia is increasingly affecting urban women in India, as a result of changing diets and lifestyles and the rise of processed convenient foods.

Taylor Swift enters 12th era, announces new album The Life of a ShowgirlPop singer Taylor Swift confirmed her forthcoming 12th album in an Instagram video promoting the Wednesday special episode of boyfriend Travis Kelce's podcast 'New Heights'.

How much chai is too much? Rujuta Diwekar answersMorning wake-up call, breakfast companion, afternoon energy booster or an evening must-have, a cup of tea can mean so much to different people. It's an emotion but not without its price. Rujuta Diwekar shares tips for incorporating tea into a healthy lifestyle.

Put terror tag on Bishnoi gang: Canada Opposition after Kapil Sharma cafe attackCanada's Opposition party has urged Prime Minister Mark Carney to designate the India-based Lawrence Bishnoi gang a terrorist organisation. The demand follows recent attacks on comedian Kapil Sharma's Surrey cafe. Conservative MP and public safety critic Frank Caputo highlighted the gang's violent record and extortion threats targeting the South Asian community, saying a terror tag would empower law enforcement with stronger tools to tackle the group.
Chhattisgarh teacher admits turning up drunk in shorts to school 'on doctor's advice'A head teacher in Chhattisgarh arrived drunk at school and claimed medical advice required alcohol consumption.

sports.headline: Karnataka bars Women's World Cup matches at Bengaluru stadium over safety fearsBengaluru's M Chinnaswamy Stadium has been dropped from the Women's World Cup 2025 schedule after the Karnataka government refused permission citing safety risks. KSCA expressed disappointment, noting the June 4 stampede happened during a privately organised celebration, not a cricket match.

Jasprit Bumrah slammed by Azharuddin over workload claims: Can't pick and chooseFormer India captain Mohammed Azharuddin slammed Jasprit Bumrah for picking and choosing matches in the name of workload management. Bumrah played just three matches during the England tour.

Witnessed Mohammed Siraj's yorker from the best seat in house: Kumar DharmasenaUmpire Kumar Dharmasena recalled India's winning moment from the fifth Test against England at the Oval and said that he had the best seat in the house to witness Mohammed Siraj's yorker.

Kohli and Rohit made error in quitting Test cricket: Aakash ChopraAakash Chopra believes that Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma should have not retired from Tests, but could have hung up their boots in ODI cricket. He feels it will not be easy for the legendary duo to stay in groove amid lack of white-ball cricket.

Vidit Gujrathi holds Keymer, keeps title race alive in ChennaiVidit Gujrathi held leader Vincent Keymer to a draw in Round 5 of the Chennai Grandmasters Chess, keeping the title race alive as Arjun Erigaisi also shared points ahead of their table-topping clash on Day 6.

D Gukesh makes comeback to finish Day 1 of St. Louis Rapid and Blitz at thirdD Gukesh made a stunning comeback to finish Day 1 of the St. Louis Rapid and Blitz at joint-third on August 11. Gukesh lost the first match and then went on to win the next two to end the day with four points.

Cincinnati Open: Sinner beats Diallo, Fritz passes Sonego TestJannik Sinner registered a dominating win against Canada's Gabriel Diallo to keep his title defence alive. Taylor Fritz also made his way into the last 16 as he breezed past Lorenzo Sonego 7-6(4) 7-5.

Ashwin adds value to CSK, but not at his price tag: S Badrinath makes big claimS Badrinath has claimed that CSK should think about releasing R Ashwin, given his current price tag. Ashwin was bought for 9.75 crore rupees by Chennai during the IPL 2025 mega auction.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
